qas.question: Who standardized the books of the New Testament?
What books were used before his decision to standardize?
How many books are listed that should be included but were not?
How many books are in the New Testament?
Have those books changed over time?
Who standardized the books of the Old Testament?
What books were used after his decision to standardize?
How many books are listed that shouldn't be included?
How many books are in the old Testament?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Athanasius<b5_0/><a0_0/> is the first person to identify the same <a3_0><b8_0>27 books<b8_0/><a3_0/> of the New Testament that are <a4_0>in use today<a4_0/>. Up until then, <a1_0><b6_0>various<b6_0/><a1_0/> similar lists of works to be read in churches were in use. Athanasius compiled the list to resolve questions about such texts as The Epistle of Barnabas. Athanasius includes the Book of Baruch and the Letter of Jeremiah and places the Book of Esther among the "<a2_0><b7_0>7 books<b7_0/><a2_0/> not in the canon but to be read" along with the Wisdom of Solomon, Sirach (Ecclesiasticus), Judith, Tobit, the Didache, and the Shepherd of Hermas.
